Description: Round-topped limestone stela divided into five registers: 1 - Two wedjat-eyes. 2 - Scene of a figure seated by an offering-table to the left, four rows of Hieroglyphic text to the right. 3 - Three kneeling figures divided by columns of Hieroglyphic text. 4 - Nine columns of Hieroglyphic text. 5 - Two kneeling figures and Hieroglyphic text. On the back is a trial sketch of fish.
Bibliographic references: Hall 1912 / Hieroglyphic texts from Egyptian stelae, etc., in the British Museum, Part 3. (pl.27)
